solution_line_template: The wife saves ${wife_weekly_savings}/week x {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = ${wife_monthly_savings} a month.

Together, the wife and husband save ${wife_monthly_savings}/month + ${husband_monthly_savings}/month = $<<{wife_monthly_savings}+{husband_monthly_savings}={total_monthly_savings}>>{total_monthly_savings}/month.

In {savings_duration_months} months, their total savings is ${total_monthly_savings}/month x {savings_duration_months} months = $<<{total_monthly_savings}*{savings_duration_months}={total_savings_after_duration}>>{total_savings_after_duration}.
So, they can buy ${amount_to_invest} / ${cost_per_share}/share = <<{amount_to_invest}/{cost_per_share}={number_of_shares}>>{number_of_shares} shares of stocks.
